info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cumberland, east central Prince Edward, northwestern Nottoway and southwestern Amelia Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 851 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Guinea Mills, or near Longwood University, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rice around 910 PM EDT. Burkeville and Jetersville around 935 PM EDT. Crewe around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Raines Tavern, Angola, Twin Lakes State Park, Rodophil, Burkes Tavern, Moran, Maplewood, Fergusonville, Jennings Ordinary and Stoddert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
